review: Just Fair I have now been here twice and both times the food was fair at best.  The last time I was there I ordered French Onion soup and sent it back twice, the first 2 times it was only marginally warm.  Even the 3rd time it was only slightly warmer.  I guess they just can't serve hot soup.

The food was very good and a lot of it, the prices were pretty much in line with similar restaurants. Things were clean, bright & cheery. The wait staff was very pleasant and helpfull. It was the first time I had eaten at Red Robbin and I will be back.

I just called in and spoke with the hostess to ask for them to sing to my Dad for his birthday. I am 3,000 miles away and would have loved to be there, but since I'm not I thought he would enjoy being surprised with some singing and dessert. To my surprise.....no one ever sang or acknowledged his birthday. I know his server was Kat, which I told the hostess. I'm not sure if it was a miscommunication or not but it was upsetting especially being in the hospitality industry myself, I love to create memorable moments for all of my guests.......
Please bring back Miller lite bottles!!!! Also please don't run out of Corona!!! Food is always great! Servers here are super! Always friendly and pay attention to detail!!!! Very kid friendly place!

A place like RR truly defines a solid but never overwhelming three star experience. The kids meals are a decent value as the entrees are of a good size and they have a decent array of healthier sides with fruits & vegetables instead of most chain places that only offer fries or look at you like you're nuts if you ask about subbing out said fried items. The adult entrees were a Banzai Burger and a Turkey Burger.  The Turkey Burger was cooked alright but they added way too much of the spicy sauce to it so that each bite turned into a slop fest.  The lovely wife proclaimed her Banzai acceptable although it was almost a bit too pink for her tastes/what she asked for. The infamous bottomless fries now matter more than ever since RR started practicing portion control by putting your first round of fries in that stupid metal cup.  I suppose it's a great idea for their bottom line but it's annoying no doubt to the service staff/the paying customers when only eight fries show up with your burger so you know right away that you likely are going to be asking/waiting for more. As for the service, nothing extraordinary as it was after the lunch rush and even though our server had quite a few tables to look after she more or less kept up with clearing plates & drink refills. On a ranting sidebar, the Ziosk is still the most stupid & annoying thing to ever enter the world of chain dining.  We're not one of those modern mutant families that must be entertained/titillated at all times so  the rare times we visit a RR the first thing to get removed from the table and put either on the window sill or the floor is the Ziosk.

The sports bar ambiance of this place is great. The service was friendly (if not a little on the slow side), but once the food came we were satisfied. I got the classic burger, which was great. The garlic fries were also quite good, and overall was quite a nice little chain experience. Nothing too out of this world, but worth a try. (More of a 3.5, though).
My meal was good.  Two others in our group was a bit tough.  They made it right by removing the bad meals from the bill.  Our server did a good job considering the rough circumstances.
The burgers are very good here. They have the best gluten free buns of any restaurant I have ever had. Red white and blue salad was huge!  Our party says Yumm!

Food was very good! Service was great but not as personable as I would have liked. I blame the electronic machine at your table for that. Its a neat gadget, but it takes away from the waitress a lot. I had the freckled lemonade (pictured), it was perfect.

What a pathetic comedy club that makes its money from selling food.  The server was top drawer, but told us jokes, and there were plenty of jokes on our plates and table.  The server would put down plates noting that 'be careful!  this is very hot!'.  This is normally slightly funny because usually they are not very hot -- in this case, given that the food came out quite late, it probably was true at one point.  But, when she said that for a plastic basket, we were LOL, rolling in the aisles (once she left).  The all you can drink rootbeer floats were tall, but skinny.  tall means that the are big (skinny means that if you are an adult and past that Piagetian stage, you know better).   The bottomless fries were literally bottomless, they came in a small ring (that is, no bottom!, haha, lol).  The burgers are meh, and I am not so keen on burgers to start with. the wrap next to me was meh, the water with lemon was good, though.  the burger across from me was meh.  the nachos were meh, the buffalo chicken boneless, that might be worth trying again.   The ordering kiosk offers games, but you have to pay (but only after you order your drinks, AND the drinks are entered, AND you can't order water (wags finger)).  And, there were not enough to go around, batteries not charged you know.  And, a button to call the waitress, but she can't see it, I'm told.  HaHa! I will eat here again only when I have to.  meh.
Over priced promotional burger that took FOREVER to be served.  Server was nice but she disappeared for a good while to get my drink (mango-something ice tea) . I wont be back though.

I was so excited to eat here because I LOVE a good burger. So a place that says they have the best, specialize in it, and whose menu is filled with different kinds and options should be able to nail a good burger, right? Let's talk temperature. Any "burger joint" should have this down to a science. But I ordered a medium rare burger and it came out beyond well done. The bread was really soggy, the fixings not fresh at all, and I opted for the broccoli instead of fries and almost threw up when I ate one piece. It was that bad, and really overcooked. I didn't send it back because I at least try to be a really easy customer. I just wanted to pay, give my excellent server Ian a good tip, and get out of there. My fellow diners had similar terrible food, but I'll leave it to them to review it. The good thing, if there was one, was the bottomless drinks outside of fountain drinks. The lemonade, etc., was all good. But, they put a TON of ice in it and it took forever to get a refill. I resorted to just drinking their water, which was disgusting because it was unfiltered and had a nasty taste. I thought most restaurants these days have industrial water filters, especially if the city water is nasty. If it was all super cheap I could probably forgive it. But for a comparable price you can get a great artisan burger cooked to perfection at any decent restaurant. Really a shame...and a ripoff.

What an amazing venue. It's open and inviting with fun decor and a butt ton of TVs! And let's not forget the food: Always amazing! I've never been disappointed going to Red Robin and this last dining trip was no different. Exceptional dining experience. Although, Emmey wasn't very fond of our waitress. She was a kind young lady but too often ran her gossiping mouth with employees (where the customers could hear). Emmey didn't care much about the gossip if her salad and drink were getting refilled. Emmey was not happy. But overall everything about our experience was nice. Great place. Great food. Ok service. Good job Red Robin! We are sure to return soon enough for more of your delicious gourmet burgers! - Mz

Nice location and great staff. This is probably one of the nicest Red Robin's I've been at. Food was okay - could have used more seasoning and more topping, but it was delicious. The place does need some deep cleaning. I could see some cob webs in the area furthest from the bar which was where we were sitting. Staff are friendly and speedy with service. We met up with an old friend and felt we were being watched because we stayed over to catch up. Never came to pick up our plates while we were chatting. Good place for a quick burger.
Beware!! This place charges $7.50 for a blue moon draft and $7 for wine they pre-measure in a measuring cup!! Do NOT drink here!!

I enjoy burger joints. so with that, I decided to try Red Robin with the family. I probably should have just cooked on the grill. It wasn't all bad, at least.  Without really getting into a full fledged and detailed review,  I will just give it something simple as I really don't want to waste much time on this one.  The problem with this page isn't with the servers. They were great. they earned this page two stars.  The food didn't.  Honestly, I was a little shocked at the bill after the subpar food. The French Dip was nearly flavorless and the onions were soggy. The cole slaw was also nearly tasteless. My family all got burgers. They complain about the mediocre taste. The fries were standard steak fries. They were decent. But not overly impressive.  So when in the Colonial Park area and you are itching for a burger, maybe try 5 guys. Around $65 bill for two kids meals, two burgers, a French Dip, sodas and a beer. Oh, and really tasteless pretzel bites. That was before tip. Not worth it.

Came for dinner around 5:30. Had to wait about four minutes for a hostess (or anyone) to greet me. Once I was acknowledged, seemingly reluctantly, I was seated. From there, the service was great: fast, friendly, and attentive. A+ The restaurant appeared clean and taken care of. A The food... Not so great. I requested "some pink" in my guacamole bacon burger. It came well-done. And while there was plenty of bacon, there was virtually no guacamole. C- Ziosk? An annoying gimmick, but maybe more fun/useful for larger groups and families.

When I'm in a place that's not  a bastion of veg-friendliness, it's nice to know there are chains that can accommodate me.  Red Robin can substitute a Gardenburger (vegetarian) or Boca Vegan Burger on any burger item on the menu for no extra charge.  Just ask them to cook it on a separate part of the grill.  I don't go fancy--just a veggie burger with lettuce, tomato, onions, ketchup, and mustard; plus a side of fries is fine by me.  That they are endless fries is nice, but I've never needed to take advantage of that. So the food is decent and filling. The service depends on time of day and how full the restaurant is.  On our most recent visit, they got hit with a large group, and in spite of it being late and not otherwise crowded, the service at our table suffered a bit.  But it happens.  I know from experience that large groups are difficult. It's not my favorite place in the world, but if there's a Red Robin nearby and not many other options, I'll go there for a meal.
Very long wait time for a table and our food . Also took a long time to pay our bill because the table scanners were not working ....

A busy Friday night with groups waiting and my wife and I were seated right away.  Our waitress came  within 5 minutes and took our order.  Food was out quickly and it was very good.  She followed up with us frequently to see how the food was and gave us refills without asking.  Manager stopped by to ask how our food was as well.  The Ziosk machine was nice so u can pay at ur table without having to wait for anyone.  Excellent experience.

We went here for lunch for my sons 2nd birthday. The best part about Red Robin is there is something for everyone. Whether you want a gourmet burger, chicken, or a salad, we were all completely satisfied our meals. It cost less than $70 for the 6 of us which to me is amazing, and they SANG HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!! I love places that do that. Our server was extremely friendly and on top of everything. We've been there twice and I have always left happy!

Been a while since we been at a RED Robin! Ordered their Prime Chophouse Burger and a Chimi Burger! We both got what we ordered the bummer was it took awhile and I think it sat the Fries were not very warm the burgers were warmer on the bottom I Fact mine came with an onion ring on top that was actually cold!  Now I know it was a Friday night but it was 9 pm place is open till midnight wasn't packed but yet seemed like most of the staff was already wiped out for the evening! I ordered a Yuengling Lager and I have to tell you if I was Dick Yuengling I would have been ticked because it wasn't all that cold not sure if their tap system was low on the CO2 or the coils not iced or if the fave me a mug straight out of the dishwasher but I am definitely not used to warm Yuengling! Well the 1 Star  is for the Second order of fries of their bottomless fries they came out hot crispy and delicious! To bad our meal didn't make it out the same way!  Hopefully it was just an off night for this Red Robin! As for me I may be sticking with WayBack!

I am writing this for catharsis. My recent visit to the Red Robin in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania was a complete disaster. I get emails every week from Red Robin for their BOGO burger specials. I am away from home during the week so I decided to invite the friend that I am staying with to get dinner with me at Red Robin. 1. We order. Food comes out. Everything is fine. We ask for drink refills when our food is brought to the table. 2. The waitress sets my drink on the table, and then proceeds to spill my friend's large Coke all over him, all over his food, and all over his phone. We scramble to dry off his phone. 3 other staff members come over to help clean up the mess. We are moved to another table. The phone seems to be fine. However, my friend's dinner was ruined because the bun soaked up the coke. The staff tells us that he'll get another burger pronto. Everyone makes mistakes, so we are fine at this point. Coke-soaked and wet, but fine. 3. We wait another 15-20 minutes. Don't see the waitress, and then she finally comes over to the table and asks us if we need anything else. I ask when they are going to bring my friend's burger. She gets annoyed and asked why he would get another burger. I said, as nicely as possible, because the first burger was ruined. She storms off to the kitchen. This young lady just dumped a large coke all over my friend and now she has an attitude about the situation. 4. Manager brings over the burger after another 10-15 minutes. 5. Try to pay the bill, but since we were moved to another table there is no computer pay station at the new table. I don't see our waitress at this time so I get someone else to help. They bring a computer pay station to us. But there is no bill on the pay station. 6. I then click the CALL WAITRESS button. The waitress comes over and puts the bill on the pay station which takes about another 10 minutes. But it isn't at the special price, it's at full price. She says that she can't help us with that. At this point I am in disbelief and I lose it. I go and find a manager. I explain what has been going on, and the manager then tells me that the food is on the house because of the situation. What a mess. Red Robin, get it together? I know that working in food service is not a fun job. But you can't hire young kids to wait on tables that are going to give people a terrible attitude AFTER dumping drinks all over the customers. OMG get it together.

Ordered their $14 "finest" madlove burger. Smaller than expected for a $14 burger. The citrus-marinated tomatoes and onions consisted of two of the worlds smallest tomatoes and one little red onion circle. The shredded Romaine lettuce was old and slimy. The jalapeño relish was almost nonexistent, perhaps they were trying to save money by putting only a teaspoon on?  The candied bacon was missing and when I asked our server she seemed irritated. She brought me regular bacon. I asked about the candied bacon and she said it doesn't come with candied bacon. I shouldn't have to inform the staff what ingredients come on the food they serve, but she did bring me candied bacon then. Overall, the burger was gross and certainly wasn't worth $14.  One of the kids ordered the pasta with a side of fries and they brought a side of tangerines or oranges or whatever the hell they were. Won't be eating at a Red Robin robin again. Have tried multiple locations and they all suck.

I've been eating here for a long time and I finally decided to leave a review ( ‍). Well, I love their burgers, bottomless sides and services! Typically, I don't eat a lot of American burgers but when I'm craving for one, I would go to Red Robin.

Me and friend went there like 9:40 ish. The place close at 11. It took about 10 mins for someone take our order. Order 2 burger both paddles are burnt. The fries are mixed with leftovers. Worst burger ever.

I used to love Red Robin.  And I still LIKE it okay but there are things now that make it not my favorite burger spot.   What I DO like are the fries.  WHEN they're fresh they are awesome!  Crispy steak fries with that Red Robin Seasoning salt.  SO good.  The burgers are juicy and you can get almost anything you want on them.  They have gone up in price substantially from when I started going there but they're still tasty. I guess they're trying that burger and beer "pub" feel.  Not really working.  Its still a family restaurant to me.  They do have a great rewards program that's all digital now.  You simply put your phone number into the tablet on the table and it will calculate your transactions.  I've often been surprised with a free burger upon check out.  What I don't like are the fact that the prices went up.  Plus their alcohol prices are insane.  And not in a good way.  You could get a domestic draft and pay about $7.  Its a chain in PA why $7 for a miller lite?  Oh well.  Also the place is not always very clean which takes away from their burger bar feel and back down to the kid friendly family place.  The bathrooms are ALWAYS dirty.  Everytime my daughter tells me she has to go I cringe.  I've  never been to a place that has had a bathroom as consistently dirty as this Red Robin.   Anyway I'll return when I have a free burger or I am getting a craving for their fries.  But I am disappointed at the decline in cleanliness and consistency.

A for taste, C for service. Upon arrival the hostess was extra frazzled and kept referring to my boyfriend and I as "these people," which although unintentional, was super off-putting. We finally arrived to our seat which was next to a huge table of dirty dishes and mess, which was strange, because it did not seem like they were too busy on a Thursday evening. While leafing through my menu, there was some food on the pages and sticky spots, but I tried to ignore it. Having recently given up meat (who knows how long this will last...) I decided to get the Garden Burger and a side of ranch. I requested that we receive our fries ahead of our meal, as all locations typically accommodate. The fries took around 10-15 minutes to receive, sans sauce. Then, it took until my meal come to finally be able to get my sauce, as my server was nowhere to be found to request my dipping sauce for my fries. My meal, which by the way, I watched sit under a heat lamp for about 10 minutes before someone finally took notice and brought it to my table. When my burger arrived, my boyfriend's burger had items on it that he had requested not be on his burger, luckily I eat pickles, so I got those. However, my burger was practically falling apart. Luckily, it tasted delicious, but I may as well just ordered a burger salad, because this was not a handheld meal, but rather one that required extra effort to keep it all from falling out of the bun. Although I love my burgers and my bottomless fries, this was not the experience of a return customer.

I have to admit that this place is either 'growing' on me or they're getting better. I had a great experience today with my two younger kids (3 and 6). Our waiter was not put off by their questions and food order and took them seriously. Mucho appreciado! My burger was cooked to my order (medium) and was nice and pink on the inside. Food came out quick enough and apples as well as drinks were provided in a swift manner.  I was surprised about the fact that 'they' had ran out of oranges (12.10pm???) with a supermarket nearby but that was the only downer.

Stopped in on the way back to KY for a quick bite. I realize we have one in Lexington but I've never been so thought why not... the burgers are good as are the steak fries. We had a great server and were in and out in as little as 30-45 min if that. Great alternative to some of the fast food places you see next to the highway.

People know this place is for burgers. They're ok. Not too too bad and not the best. Price range from $8- $15 for burgers. Comes with unlimited fries. They also have some entrees too. And they serve alcohol.  Kids menu are good. Around $6 and up. Comes with sides and a drink. If you have children, Tuesday is the best day to come in. Because the red robbin will be there and the also have a balloon too. My kids love to eat there!

Started at the front door when three people that work there all at one table chatting and looking at us. It took a few minutes for them to stop whatever it is they were doing and have the one with the least experience come over and Feed Us. Then we order a drink and an appetizer the girl comes back a few minutes later and says we don't have that to me do you want anything else. I had no idea what she was talking about. I then asked her what it was but she was out of and she said the Jen I ordered. I then said do you have Hendricks? She was not sure. So I said why don't you go get a list of the gyms you have and come back to me and tell me what you have. 10 minutes later she finally comes back with a few genes that they have. I order my Jen and at this point my husband has still not got his beer that he ordered. Three or four minutes later go by and we finally get our drinks and our appetizers. The cheese for my pretzel bites was cold. When the burgers came out the quality to me seems mediocre. Unfortunately I don't think we'll be back. To top it all off my husband got their special fries. They came out with a glob of garlic and cheese on the top. Not even tossed like it normally is. Just bad quality all around.

Red Robin's claim to fame is the wide variety of burger options plus bottomless steak fries but this restaurant fell short of the mark. The food was satisfactory and likely worthy of 4 stars; however, the poor service caused it to drop a star.  A group of 4 of us stopped in for a late lunch and after a short wait were taken to our table. Walking through the seating area is a little tricky. I understand the desire to pack as many tables as possible into the building but when there isn't room for me to slip past some of the larger customers it may be time to redesign the layout.  Our waitress quickly took our food and drink orders but then disappeared until bringing our meals. I asked for mustard but she forgot about me and didn't bring it until my last bite of burger.  The food is decent when it comes to burgers but in my opinion the menu needs simplified. Too many options and choices especially when they push the idea of "build your own burger"... why even have such an option if every burger imaginable is already on the menu. The fries are great but don't buy into the idea of bottomless. The second serving is smaller and after being brought to the table the waitresses seem to disappear - mostly bc you use the kiosk on the table to pay your bill so they have no reason to come back around.  Food is worth coming back for again and hopefully service will be improved.

We were not thrilled with this visit. We ordered a full order of zucchini sticks since you can only get them in the combo. I got them because I remember them being lightly fried and the zucchini still a little crunchy. That was not the case this time. They were over fried and smelled like they might need to change their oil. My husband ordered a bacon cheeseburger with bottomless fries, mom had a cup of soup, I had a bowl of french onion with boneless wings. The soups were not piping hot.  The customer service during this visit was pretty crappy. We were asked if a table was ok. I asked if we could have half booth and half table and was told no, just a table. Once seated at our salty table (yes, salt and crumbs left from previous guests) I noticed 2 tables that were half booth, half table. I asked a passing waitress if we could have one of them she said yes.  We ate, our waiter was cool. Had to ask for our check. Paid on the table top thingy and left. There were 5 young girls at the hostess station, another employee and a manager to the right when we left. No one thanked us for coming or invited us to return. The service is worse every time we go. I doubt we will go back any time soon.

It's a chain. You get what you get. The burgers are good, sometimes better than good. The service is okay, sometimes less than ok. They seem to attract hordes of children, particularly youth sports teams, like a magnet so you can't count on any kind of conversation with the people you stop in with. We eat here when it is convenient and not too crowded but do not and would not go out of our way.

Haven't had a bad experience here. I usually tend to go when there are promotions or new burgers. Its probably the better of the few Red Robins around, but I don't go enough to be an adequate judge. I can say that the franchise does tend to offer some pretty cool promotions that are worth your time. Things like BOGO deals and special events.  *I don't really have a favorite burger. In fact I have never ordered the same one twice. Trying new ones is what brings me here. The variety is very appealing.

We have eaten at other locations and had a better experience due to service.   5 people don't want to eat over a 2 1/2 hour period when 2 of the people are kids.  We think they lost our order as that machine on our table that the waiter used wasn't working, but he insisted on using it.   milkshakes were fine, burgers were fine, bottomless fries weren't bottomless as you could never find your waiter to get another serving. Restaurant is EXTREMELY loud, so hard to carry on a conversation across the table.

I walked in to this Red Robin during a slightly busy dinner rush.  There were 3 hostesses, all young girls, neither happy to be there. After I stood there, awkwardly standing in front of them, the one notices me and says in her best ebonics, "what chu want?"  I replied, ".....to eat here..... Is there a wait?" She snapped at me, "how many!?" I replied, "two." She dramatically sighs, "ughhhhhh," and continues to ignore me as she carries on a personal conversation with the two other girls.  I walked out. I used to enjoy coming here, but if this is how you're treated, there are many other places to eat.

Very kid friendly/family friendly burger joint.  Milkshakes are great.  Very wide selection of burger combinations. Veggies are always fresh and tasty. The sauces are good. Price is better than 5 Guys, and I would rank overall food quality higher and variety blows them out of the water. I recommend the Ghost Tavern Double if you like a nice spicy burger.

We stopped in for lunch because I wanted a burger. After looking at the menu I ordered the clam strips. A far cry from a burger but it got my attention. Our food came in a reasonable amount of time. The clam strips were good but half way through there was a strip of METAL between 2 pieces of breading!  Fortunately I didn't swallow it. I called the server and she took the metal and breading to the manager. After 10 - 15 minutes without a manager showing up we left the correct amount for the bill and walked out, never to return.

Came in here for a lunch break with a friend.  My main complaint about the restaurant is the new "ziosk" feature.  It's basically an iPad on the table where you order your drinks, requests for refills, order your appetizers, and pay on the Ziosk.  My friend and I haven't been there for some time, and when our server seated us, she quickly explained what the ziosk was and zoomed away.  We figured our server would come by and re explain the machine or at least get our drink order (since she only had one other table), but she didn't come by for a good 15 minutes until we had to flag her down.   When we ordered our drinks and apps, she just put them on the Ziosk and walked away.  A different server came out with our orders, and when we paid on the Ziosk after our meal it automatically suggested we tip 20%. 20%. Really? You want me to pay 20% on what basically was an experience I could have had from just going to Sonic? Needless to say, I readjusted the tip to what I saw fit and we both left unsatisfied.  The Ziosk would be convient...if you are not expecting to be served.  To be honest, what's the point of having servers?  The stupid thing was also taking up obnoxious amount of space on our small 2 person table. If they got rid of the Ziosk this review would have had a lot higher rating, but unfortunately that is not the case. Not everything has to be tech savvy these days!
This is our favorite place to eat when hungry for burgers. They have the best in the area.

Was in last night for quick dinner. Seated in bar area by our server. Given a stack of menus.  Happy to be in the bar area.  There were some noisy kids in the dinning room. Inquired about beers available - No Fat Tire!!!  Got the Sam Adams Seasonal. Dinner partner ordered a Guinness 'milkshake'.  I have a problem with beer and ice cream. I ordered the Royal Red Robin Burger - No Salt fries. Partner ordered the Whiskey River Bbq Chicken Wrap - No Salt fries and dressing on the side.  Both dishes cme from the kitchen as requested. We were both satisfied with the food and service.
Stopped on our way down 81. Good burger and garlic fries. Nice waitress.

My husband, 18 month old son, and I were in for dinner tonight. Our server was extremely friendly and quick in taking our order and getting anything extra we needed. The busser on several occasions stopped by to bring our (grouchy) son a balloon and a box when he was ready to go. I sincerely appreciated both of their attentiveness during our meal tonight. Its not always easy to take a toddler to dinner but they made our experience wonderful!

This is the first Red Robin I've been to, which was roughly 2 years ago.  I tried my first burger with an egg in it here. Well, I tried a bite of one - I ordered a regular burger. There are few things that I love - french fries being one of them. In particular, steak fries. So when I heard, they have free refills on steak fries aka botttomless fries - I almost went into cardiac arrest. heh. Was I able to actually partake in this? No, but I like having the option. The whiskey bbq chicken salad here was surprisingly good - all things considering - this is a burger joint. This location is probably the biggest Red Robin I've seen. It's big with high ceilings and clean.  It sits on the very end of the strip of businesses it is next to. Big parking lot. If only they had this place, when I was in highschool. Yummy place for the teeny boppers to hang out and eat. Peep the pix.

Last night we stopped in for dinner.  The place was full of smoke.  Obviously their kitchen exhaust fan was not working.  We were seated and sat for five to ten minutes before waited on.  Got the story on the exhaust fan and they were trying to get it fixed.  Then the fire alarm went off.  It was silenced.  A few minutes later the alarm goes off again.  Stays on longer.  Finally, we get to order drinks.  Alarm goes off.  We left.  After getting outside, I check it out and there appears to be no one working on the exhaust fan.  Got to wonder if service and atmosphere are second to the all mighty dollar.

Ordered one of their promotional burgers with peppered bacon.  The bacon was pathetic...it looked like they put regular bacon on the burger and sprinkled pepper on it.  The server said it was peppered bacon and didn't offer to get us more fries.

If I could give this less than 1 star I would.  Stopped at Red Robin {GAG} for a quick lunch with a friend today. I am NOT a fan of the table top payment machines (I think Chili's has them also). After our server took our order we never saw her again...a runner brought out our food, and I had to ask her for an ice tea refill. Our server never checked on us, asked if we needed refills, etc. When we attempted to pay this machine automatically added a 20% tip ($2.01), normally that would have been okay, but I have more contact with the server at McDonald's and don't leave a tip there. 1st and last time at Red Robin....no wonder they were empty at lunchtime!  NEVER AGAIN!!!!

I've always been a sorta' fan of Red Robin because I liked their interesting variety of burgers and their beer selection. After being away for some time, though, I was disappointed last week to find that the beer selection was pretty darn paltry. For having a menu that emphasizes "local beer," the nearest brewery available was Sam Adams, which is not even made in Latrobe anymore. Everything else was your typical BudMillerCoors served everywhere. The burgers are not good enough to make me drink bad beer. I won't be going back.

Typically when I go here I either get the patty melt or chicken fingers. Both are very tasty in my opinion. The fries are amazing and they keep coming until you can't eat anymore. The negative one star was for customer service. I know it can get busy in there but having to wait a long time for drinks irks me. Also one time I went the hostess was crying and barely said two words to us. But overall great restaurant..

It's Red Robin so the food is what you would expect, so reviewing these place, to me, is more about the service and the cleanliness of the place. So that being said, the guy that waited on us was nice. He seemed a little new. he brought us the wrong meal for our son,  when we got our food we noticed we didn't have any silverware or napkins. when our server came by we asked him and he asked if we really need it because they were running low. looking around, the place was full but not packed. we said we would just take some napkins. the place was clean, i never went in the bathroom. overall the food was good but service was left us wanting.
Staff wasn't so attentive, took awhile for food to arrive. Food was decent.

My Mother, my 8 yr old son and myself went to eat here before we took my mother to the airport.  We really wanted to visit before she left.  The music was soooooo loud we couldn't even talk or hear each other!  We asked if they could turn down the music so we could visit but we were told that they always keep the music up that loud!!!  UNBELIEVABLE.... Made for a very unpleasant meal!  That is my only complaint regarding this restaurant!

Get rid of the Ziosk! If I want to put in my own order on a computer I will go to Sheetz.  The servers seem to expect it to do their job. We always pay cash and it takes forever for the server to come collect it.  We usually go for a free birthday burger for someone in the family. I tried a salad this time and although it was fresh and the grilled chicken had good flavor it was quite small. I doubt there was more than a tablespoon of diced tomatoes on it.  They also tend to over season the fries. They provide extra seasoning on the table for those who LOVE salty food so why add so much in the kitchen? If you're wondering why I even go there it is for my husband who thinks the clucks & fries are the best thing ever.  They always bring us our check and forget to take off the free meal, so we have to flag our server down and have them correct it. Then we figure out the tip and wait again for the server to come back. Pressing the call server button on the Ziosk is pointless.  We waited 30 minutes from the time the server went to total our bill the first time until she finally came back to collect the money after the bill was corrected.  To sum it up, overpriced, mediocre food and slow, somewhat condescending servers.
I ordered the garden burger and it was yummy. The bartender was friendly and quick. She brought my party fries and the wait time was not too bad.
Expectation was much higher than what we got for a family of 5, cold fries, warm burgers. When your going to be a burger place you need to get those two things right.

I'll give it a 2 star only because my grand kids enjoyed the hamburgers. If you're hungry make sure you don't order the petite burger, it comes with 4 french fries and   as for the petite burger, I've  seen bigger burgers in a kids meal, as for my waitress, she spent way too much time sitting and talking to her friends which is the reason why our burgers were ice cold. My 11 year old grandson  was still hungry so i ordered another petite meal for him, we got it much quicker this time and it was very hot but he said there was a funny taste, he said his bun was burned. I told our waitress Kelsey about the burned bun and she wanted to know if he wanted a new bun, yeah right! by the time he would get a new bun his burger would be cold, No Thanks..  I won't be eating the burgers there again but I will try a Margarita, they look really yummy.

The service is slow. The wait staff seems more concerned about socializing with each other than doing their job. The reason I am giving Red Robin one star is because we are regulars and the service has become increasingly more disappointing. We will return but only because of our kids

My husband and I love going to Red Robin for a burger every now and then. The last few times service has been slow, but we just relax and enjoy an appetizer while we're waiting. Several times, the waitress has brought out a basket of fries to calm our hunger while we wait. We have had no issues with using several "free item" coupons that were found in a local mailer. Will definitely be going back soon!

Is it really incredibly difficult to cook meat all the way through??? Apparently at this Red Robin it is.  I have been there a ton of times and I always get the same thing and I always have to say.. COOK THE MEAT VERY VERY WELL DONE!  I'd have to say about 1 out of 7 times I have not had to send my food back.  I get the Nachordinary Nachos.. so it isn't like I am ordering a 15 lb burger.. its crumbles of meat... seriously. I love mudslides but refrain from ordering them here.  On two occasions I had to tell the bartender how to make it, and one time I was served a white russian ... which wouldn't have been that bad if the milk had not of been sour. ew. As an appetizer we ordered the fried zucchini and it smelled like.. well lets just say this.. the smell was so unappealing you wouldn't want to put it in your mouth. My brave husband did.. wait did I say brave.. make that absolutely starving husband.. and he almost threw up he said the smell was better than the taste which is kind of scary. Since we moved and live closer to Hershey we now dine at that location which has been better but not spectacular.. I only go because my kids love this place... which leads me to believe they either like getting the balloons or their taste buds have not developed.

I've never been a big fan of Red Robin, but it's an ok place to stop if you're out and about and want a fairly quick casual meal.  Definitely not a place I'd make a special trip for. One thing I don't understand is why a place that is supposed to have "legendary" burgers can't have better rolls. Whenever I've gotten burgers there the rolls have been stale and so dry they crumble apart.  The burger I had today would have been good if not for the stale roll and the unfresh lettuce. That's the other thing- their shredded lettuce always tastes like old lettuce that was soaked in that chemical they use to refresh produce that's on the verge of 'going over' .  It's unfortunate really. An establishment that has the volume of burger sales that they do should have no problem pulling off fresh ingredients. The service was pretty good.

My family and I ate at Red Robin last night. This was our first time there since they changed the menu. The service was spectacular! Our server Ryan took very good care of us. His timing was spot on. The new menu, not so much :( I ordered onion rings as an appetizer, which were as usual; good. They use whole  onions which were naturally sweet and the batter dip them, served on a tower with two sauces. I like the campfire sauce. I ordered the Reds Tavern double with bacon and bacon aioli. It was reported to be big on bacon favor...well it had one piece of bacon, and I could not taste the aioli. The burger was done and was tasty, but being a bacon lover, this was not bacony. If you want good burgers, they are one of the best in the area, service is great, but I DO NOT LIKE THE NEW MENU. I will take some time to come back... Oh, one last thought: As we were entering, we noticed a dead bird on a bench outside, it must have hit the glass windows and ended up on the bench...it was a Robin...Dead Robin...Humm Bad omen? maybe?

I'd say my experience here was just average all around. My burger, while cooked the way I like it, wasn't anything to go nuts over. The service was okay as well. My guy and I didn't ever have to worry about waiting for a refill or the check, but the person waiting on us seemed very overwhelmed and was a bit pushy for us to decide on things. And it's not like we take a long time to look over the menu, but I do need more than 3 minutes to choose what I'd like.

Great burgers.  Gotta love the bottemless fries that come with most meals too.  However, they seem to purposely give you a little amount of fries, hoping that you forget that they're bottomless.  Service can be slow at times.  But overall, great food.

I'm not typically a fan of chains...but Red Robin has some fantastic burgers!  (thank God there aren't any within a short drive of home!) I've been to a number of Red Robin locations and they've all been pretty consistent.  I'm sure that other menu items are good, but I've only ever ordered burgers here.  Creative toppings in yummy combos on BIG, juicy burgers!   Just forget about trying to calculate the number of calories you may be consuming and just savor the yummy goodness!

I've only been here once and it was because of those damn burger commercials for Red Robin on TV.  But holy cow (no pun intended) ... my burger was awesome!   I got the one with the works ... lettuce, tomato, bacon, cheddar, etc. and a fried egg to boot!  Bottomless fries and friendly wait staff.  Altogether a great dining experience but don't go too often ... too much yummy good artery clogging fare here!

They probably got my order right one out of 5 times on average. You may wonder why we keep going there. Well lately it has been less and less but we like buffalo burgers and not many places serve buffalo meat.  This place will screw up the most basic substitutions. All I want is a cheeseburger but with buffalo meat, NOT their buffalo burger that comes with goofy sauce and odd type of bun. Just swap buffalo for beef and thats all. Long story short they normally always get it wrong. I DO NOT send food back at a restaurant and I think you know why. One time we got take out and ordered buffalo burgers and got home to find out they used VEGGIE burgers.  They also forgot parts of our order during take out on several occasions and found a quarter (yes, the money kind) in my little season salt container once. They did send me gift cards but guess what, when we used them they screwed up the that order too.The food is good when they get it right but the service is horrible. No attention to detail. It's a bunch of young people working there who to them its just a job. This probably explains the crappy service.

Even the balloon was a flop! Red Robin has been a dependable performer for our family for several years and we expected much the same for our recent dinner. Unfortunately, the fact that my 9 year old's helium balloon sank when we brought it from the lobby to our table was an omen of things to come. We waited nearly 15 minutes before I was finally able to make eye contact with a server, any server to take our order. It was to be burgers for the parents and fish and chips for the kiddo, with an order of onion rings as a starter.  One of the (dis)advantages of an open kitchen is that patrons can spy upon when orders arrive at the pass. I was able to watch the sad story of our "towering onion rings" as they sat tall and proud on the shelf for several minutes until some other server noted that they looked lonely and cold. She then proceeded to pull them off of their tower, place them in a basket and stick them under a warming lamp for several minutes. Finally our server reappeared (from where we don't know), to then reassemble the ring tower and bring it out. Predictably, the rings were cold and greasy. I instructed the server that we wanted fresh rings and wanted them before our meal arrived. Sure enough, the meal arrived before the appetizer, so when the 2nd batch came out a few minutes after the meal, we sent them back as they were no longer relevant, and perhaps to help this poor server understand that when people ask for an appetizer to arrive first, that she must do more than simply be passive and hope that the kitchen staff can read her mind. The meal itself was underwhelming. Each entree was missing components. The bleu cheese burger had no bleu cheese, another burger was missing a topping as well as missing aside order, and a request for honey mustard dipping sauce was apparently ignored. Then after asking for it a 2nd and a 3rd time, we were given a poppy mustard salad dressing and then a dijon dressing by an apologetic manager who explained that they do not have honey mustard (curious that our server didn't tell us this when we ordered it with the meal). I am usually quite tolerant when I go out to eat, but the lackadaisical approach of both the service staff and management at this place was really quite galling. A table next to us (also with child) was waiting for their meal when we arrived and was still waiting when we got served, despite repeated calls for the server and then several managers to remedy the problem. They ultimately left after their order finally arrived and it was the wrong food.  Our server would disappear for 10 to 15 minute blocks of time. All in all, bland food, rotten service, and even a helium balloon that couldn't float. AVOID THIS LOCATION, until they have sorted out their issues in the front of the house.
Very tasty burgers and great; friendly service. Nice and clean atmosphere. Three stars cause it's a burger chain, and a good one at that!
$30 for two burgers....seriously?!  We cook them better at home for ALOT cheaper.

I've eaten at this particular Red Robin twice and I can't say that I was terribly impressed compared to other Red Robins I've been to.  The first visit was so-so, nothing bad, nothing impressive either.  On the second visit - early on a weekday evening - the table was sticky and my chair was WET when we were to be seated.  Instead of just moving us to another table, I had to stand in the half-full restaurant for a few minutes while the hostess came back with a wet rag to clean the chair off - and she didn't even wipe the table!  On top of it, our service was so slow that the table next to us came in, ordered, and got their food between when we ordered and when we got ours.  Never got offered refills on drinks or fries.  Also, the ladies' restroom was gross.  The food was pretty standard for Red Robin - but everything else was terrible.

Went here on Sunday night and my stomach will never forgive me for it. Food poisoning from their guacamole bacon burger has now laid me up for two whole days. It feels like my insides want to be on my outsides. A call from the regional manager (which i didn't ask for) today was very rude and argumentative. Next time I get this sick I hope it's from a good round of drinks with friends instead of an $8 burger.

Normally I wouldn't give a chain restaurant 5 stars, but I have NEVER had a bad experience at this, or any red robin.  Their salads are good, soup is yummy, and their burgers...wow.  My favorite is the bonzai burger, but it's so messy, I haven't had it in years.  I recommend the BLTA (bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado),  the tuna steak focaccia, the apple walnut whatever it is salad (fresh chevre, apples, candied walnuts)=mmmmmm.  We don't go often, but when we do, it's so tasty and bad for me:)
